statement.p: Snell's Law about refraction applied to sound can be stated as \displaystyle\frac{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{1}}\right)}}}}{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{2}}\right)}}}}=\frac{{V}_{{1}}}{{V}_{{2}}}.

\displaystyle{V}_{{1}}={5300} m/s in glass and \displaystyle{V}_{{2}}={5890} in 1020 steel. If an ultrasonic sound crosses from glass into 1020 steel at an angle of \displaystyle{45}^{\circ}. What angle from the normal will the sound make in the 1020 steel?
